Articles.Content:
I thought out this entire thing but then ran into a problem, how the Kerbuck do they get here? I did notice that they could be very far or very close...Rover anyone!?

Discuss if they did come on Earth right now in this year!

If Kerbals came to Earth we would immediately trade ideas with them, such as "agriculture" and "cities", in return for their secret to cheap interstellar flight. Once we arrived at Kerbal we would introduce them to ideas such as "occupation" and "tribute".

If Kerbals came to Earth we would immediately trade ideas with them, such as "agriculture" and "cities", in return for their secret to cheap interstellar flight. Once we arrived at Kerbal we would introduce them to ideas such as "occupation" and "tribute".

I wonder if their ride to Earth would be a hunk of rockets strapped together and 3 seats...maybe a parachute ontop too! Oh the destruction they'll cause upon the Earth and their rockets..
I think the real question is what country they'll land in.

I think the real question is what country they'll land in.

You know what Kerbal landings are like... The correct word may be "Countries".
Pretty sure that the first Kerbal to reach earth would be Jeb. I have very high expectations for that guy.

Obama would probably freak out and the War Generals would probably blow them up or put them into a locked down secure locaton, where they would be interrogated and experimented on... (area 51? xP)

Welcome to Earth.

In 2022 they'll coming and become..

XaT
They would land in the Sahara and call the planet boring and move on.
They'd probably be really confused as to how the planets in our system seem so massive compared to those in their system yet have similar gravity. These planets must be hollow on the inside!

They will puzzle at certain ideas and challenges in our own manned space programs, such as the ideas that among other things "food", "water", "space", and "exercise" might actually be important variables when designing and launching an interplanetary mission.
Hmm...this topic actually made me want to add it as a part of my book...except a bit more interesting! Yes, I am writing a book about Kerbals and KSP. I have 45 pages completed so far.
